Module Basics
Package basics.math.solids

Class Polyhedron

java.lang.Object
basics.math.solids.SurfaceCollection
basics.math.solids.Polyhedron
public class Polyhedron
extends SurfaceCollection
Modelling a convex, but not neccessarily regular polyhedron to perform certain geometric queries.

              \ | /
               000

                 110----------111

    • Polyhedron

      public Polyhedron​(double[][] bottomPolygon, double[][] topPolygon)
      Create a polyhedron from a prism. Bottom and top polygons are given. The prism contains top, bottom and all side rectangles.
      Parameters:
      bottomPolygon - bottom polygon, counter-clockwise form top view
      topPolygon - top polygon, counter-clockwise form top view

  • Method Details

    • isInside

      public boolean isInside​(double[] point)
      Is the given point inside this polyhedron.
      Parameters:
      point - point
      Returns:
      inside?

    • intersectWithLine

      public double[][] intersectWithLine​(double[] point1, double[] point2)
      Intersect a line segment with this polyhedron ('inner' not only with hull). The result either is
      • the original line segment, if the line completely is inside,
      • null, if the line completely is outside,
      • a one-end-shortened line segment, if one endpoint is inside, one outside or
      • a two-end-shortened line segment, if both endpoints are outside, but the line goes through the polyhedron.
      Parameters:
      point1 - line segment's start point
      point2 - line segment's end point
      Returns:
      array of two point if there is an intersection, null for no intersection

    • intersectWithPlane

      public double[][] intersectWithPlane​(double[] planePoint, double[] planeNormal)
      Intersect a plane with this polyhedron ('inner' not only with hull). The result either is a convex polygon or null. If the plane intersects in only a point or line, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      planePoint - one point of the plane
      planeNormal - the normal vector of the plane
      Returns:
      convex polygon or null, if intersection is empty

    • intersectWithPolygon

      public double[][] intersectWithPolygon​(double[][] polygon, double[][] plane, double[] polygonMBR)
      Intersect a polygon with this polyhedron ('inner' not only with hull). The result either is
      • the original polygon, if it is completely inside,
      • the cut of the original polygon, if it is partly inside and outside,
      • a polygon completely inside the original polygon, if all polygon edges are outside this polyeder, but the areas intersect or
      • null, if the polygon an its area completely is outside.
      Parameters:
      polygon - polygon – a sequence of points
      plane - plane of the polygon as computed by Geom.getPlane(double[][]), may be null, then this method computes the plane on its own
      polygonMBR - polygon's MBR as array of 6 with minX,maxX,minY,maxY,minZ,maxZ
      Returns:
      polygon of intersection or null for empty intersection

    • intersectWithPolyhedronSurfaces

      public SurfaceCollection intersectWithPolyhedronSurfaces​(Polyhedron ph)
      Intersect this polyhedron with the given polyhedron's surfaces. In particular, this is not an intersection between these polyhedrons, what would result again in a polyhedron. In contrast, this method cuts the given polyhedron's surfaces with the 'inner' of this polyhedron. As a result, it returns a collection of surfaces. In particular, no part of surface of this polyhedron is part of the result.
      Parameters:
      ph - polyhedron of which we look for intersecting surfaces
      Returns:
      parts of surfaces of the given polyhedron that fully reside in this polyhedron, is null for empty intersection

    • nearestPointOnSphereTo

      public double[] nearestPointOnSphereTo​(double[] point, double[] sphereCenter, double sphereRad)
      Get the nearest point on or in the polyhedron to the given point, that resides on a sphere surface. In other words: intersect this polyhedron and sphere surface and find the nearest point on this surface (part of the sphere surface) to a given point.
      The motivation: in gravity simulation, a polyhedron may collide with a sphere. To find the 'collision point' we need to know the point that deepest intruded into the polyhedron.
      The nearest point is one of:
      • the nearest point at all of the sphere, if this point is inside the polyhedron,
      • the nearest point of the sphere in a surface, if such a point is inside a surface
      • the nearest point of the sphere on an edge, if such a point is on an edge.
      Parameters:
      point - point to look for nearest
      sphereCenter - sphere center
      sphereRad - sphere radius
      Returns:
      nearest surface point, null if polyhedron and sphere do not have any intersection
